Overflow.tooltip: Sum of the total overflows seen in all GRCs.  Overflows can be fractional and less than one, so it is possible that the Overflow metric (total overflows) is less than GRCs (number of GRCs with overflows).

MaxOver.tooltip: Maximum global routing overflows in a single GRC

GRCs.tooltip: Number of GRCs with any amount of global routing overflows

GRC%.tooltip: Percentage of GRCs that contain any amount of global routing overflows

GRCsMax.tooltip: Number of GRCs that have the maximum number of global routing overflows shown in the MaxOver metric

HOverflow.tooltip: Total global routing overflows on horizontal layers

HMaxOver.tooltip: Maximum global routing overflows in a single GRC on horizontal layers

HGRCsMax.tooltip: Number of GRCs that have the maximum number of global routing overflows shown in the MaxOver metric, on horizontal layers

HGRCs.tooltip: Number of GRCs with global routing overflows on horizontal layers

HGRC%.tooltip: Percentage of GRCs that contain global routing overflows on horizontal layers

VOverflow.tooltip: Total global routing overflows on vertical layers

VMaxOver.tooltip: Maximum global routing overflows in a single GRC on vertical layers

VGRCsMax.tooltip: Number of GRCs that have the maximum number of global routing overflows shown in the MaxOver metric, on vertical layers

VGRCs.tooltip: Number of GRCs with global routing overflows, on vertical layers

VGRC%.tooltip: Percentage of GRCs that contain global routing overflows, on vertical layers
